faqs.question: What are the common building regulations for plots in South City 1 Gurugram
faqs.answer: Plots in South City 1 fall under the jurisdiction of the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram MCG. Building regulations typically dictate the maximum permissible height Floor Area Ratio FAR and ground coverage allowed based on the plot size. Generally for residential plots the FAR is higher for smaller plots and decreases slightly for larger ones. You must ensure proper setback areas are maintained and adhere to parking space requirements. We strongly advise obtaining the latest building sanction plan and structural design approval from the MCG before commencing any construction work to avoid penalties or demolition notices.

faqs.answer: Yes absolutely South City 1 is considered one of Gurugram's most stable and high-performing residential investment areas. Since it is a fully developed sector there is limited new supply ensuring consistent demand and superior capital appreciation rates compared to fringe markets. This stability makes a Plot For Sale in South City 1 a reliable component of any long-term portfolio.

faqs.question: What type of documentation is required when purchasing a plot here
faqs.answer: The essential documents required include the Mother Deed also known as the Title Deed proving the chain of ownership the latest non-encumbrance certificate E-C to confirm the plot is free from liabilities the mutation records showing ownership transfer in government records and the approved layout plan of the sector. Additionally you will need proof of payment of property tax and utility bills. Our legal team assists in verifying every document ensuring the Plot For Sale in South City 1 you choose has a clear and marketable title.

faqs.question: Are there specific size restrictions for builder floors in South City 1
faqs.answer: Yes while independent builder floors are highly popular in South City 1 specific rules govern their construction usually tied to the plot size and the sanctioned FAR. Generally plots 100 square yards and above are suitable. The construction must allow for adequate parking typically stilt parking and adhere to fire safety norms. Current regulations often permit up to four independent floor units on residential plots subject to revised government policies regarding density and height. Consult with an architect familiar with MCG norms.

faqs.question: How do I verify the authenticity and dimensions of a plot
faqs.answer: Verification involves two main steps legal due diligence and physical verification. Legally we check the title deeds and mutation records against government maps. Physically we recommend getting a certified land surveyor to measure the plot boundaries using GPS and demarcation techniques and comparing these measurements against the original sector layout plan provided by the development authority. This ensures the Plot For Sale in South City 1 matches the documented size and avoids future boundary disputes.

faqs.question: What is the difference between freehold and leasehold plots in Gurugram
faqs.answer: All plots offered in South City 1 are typically freehold meaning the buyer gains complete and perpetual ownership of both the land and any structures built upon it without an expiration date. Leasehold properties involve leasing the land for a fixed term usually 99 years from the development authority. Freehold Plot For Sale in South City 1 offers greater security no renewal fees and unrestricted transferability making them significantly more desirable and higher value assets.
